name: Change to how Uncanny Dodge II works
author: webshaman1

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
Apparently Uncanny Dodge II changed since patch 1.74

It basically makes anyone who has it "immune" to Sneaks from flanking if they are higher level (it does say combined levels of Barb, Rogue, Blackguard, Assassin) than the attacking sneak attacker.

Flatfooted still produces the expected results (i.e. one can sneak attack them).

What this really changes (other than PvP) are all the Monsters that have Uncanny Dodge II and more levels in the above classes as any Rogue (or combination of above with sneaks).  Kinda really put a massive crimp in the Gloomrazer build from GDL that I was levelling.

Others might want to test this.

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content: It can be helpful in PvM, depending on how the builders make monsters. Creatures that have high Death/Sneak Attack die but no Ass/BG/Rog levels are a lot easier to fight with the changes. This only matters if the builders add Death/Sneak Attack via feats rather than actually giving the monsters class levels in a Death/Sneak Attack class though.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
That is a 3.5 D&D change to Uncanny Dodge & it shouldn't be on an otherwise unaltered  3.0 Neverwinter Nights ruleset.

Why the guys doing the patch-work select only singular elements from the ruleset & leave others as they are?

Anyway, I suppose this is a net gain for the Barbarians out there.

posts.author: grizzled_dwarflord
posts.content:
webshaman1 wrote: ↑
Feb 22, 2020
 What this really changes (other than PvP) are all the Monsters that have Uncanny Dodge II and more levels in the above classes as any Rogue (or combination of above with sneaks).  Kinda really put a massive crimp in the Gloomrazer build from GDL that I was levelling.
Yes, this was one of their "changes".  In effect it is like the Dwarven Defenders Stance in that it grants protection against Flanking.  As Valerfor pointed out, this is nice boon to Barbarians, but it basically waters down the Dwarven Defender since now anyone with Uncanny Dodge II (not just Uncanny Dodge) now has the Defensive Awareness feat.  Not sure if that's what Beamdog intended, but I'm going to gripe about it on their website.

Eventually though, you should outgain your opponent in a Gloomrazor-style build since it nets 24 Rogue levels.  Unless your opponent has a butt-ton of Rogue/Assn/Barb levels.  Then you'll need to resort to some IKD or attacking from a stealthed position.

I had no idea that this was present in vanilla NWN ala patch 1.69 (albeit in a bugged form, apparently).
